body.p: There are two different kinds of secretions associated with the digestive system that need to be understood to avoid confusion when describing how the digestive system functions. Which one of these secretions will be involved in control of digestion through the blood?

response.feedback: Correct. The various endocrine hormones secreted and transported in the blood will coordinate the movement of food through the GI tract as well as the secretion of exocrine substances into the lumen.
Incorrect. These substances, such as enzymes, are secreted into the GI tract lumen and not into the blood.

question.body: What two body systems regulate and control the proper function of the digestive system?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The lymphatic system helps protect from any pathogens that might enter through the digestive system but doesn’t regulate the digestive system function.
Incorrect. The cardiovascular system does transports but doesn’t produce chemicals that control the digestive system function.
Correct. Both of these systems produce chemical messengers to coordinate proper system function and homeostasis.

body.p: All the secretion and absorption functions of digestive system need to be understood as happening at what level of organization?

response.feedback: Correct. This is the level where substances are moved between the “external environment” of the GI lumen and internal body fluids.
Incorrect. This is an important structural level to study because they make up the different organs of the digestive system, but most physiology happens at a different level.
Incorrect. This is an important structural level to study because the different organs of the system function together, but most physiology happens at a different level.

question.body: What structure-function concept is important at all levels of organization for very efficient absorption in the digestive system?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This will directly enhance digestion necessary before absorption can occur, but not the process of absorption.

Correct. The various structural features that increase the surface area exposed to the substances in the GI tract will enhance the amount of absorption that can occur while the food passes through the tube.
Incorrect. This will coordinate digestion and movement of material through the GI tract, but not the process of absorption.
Incorrect. This will directly enhance digestion necessary before absorption can occur, but not the process of absorption.
